text: <@U0YK3KKCY> <@U10Q62R8X> <@U11NUTP4L> FYI, made a v0.2.0 cut today for baseimage
<@U0YK3KKCY> when you and <@U10Q62R8X> are ready, I would anticipate a third option to the -[verify|merge|release]-docker-$arch images here
<https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric-baseimage/>
right now, its only going to push to X/P…when you are ready, we can cut a v0.2.1
<@U0KPFAZNF> i will be on conf call for next 90 mins... same goes for <@U10Q62R8X>. i will get with him after call
re: release/snapshot number... i had assumed the baseimage had a release number in the tag after cat'ing the "release" file in the fabric-baseimage repo.
i'll take a look at PR 1471
The release file is the tag
It's just only official if Makefile::IS_RELEASE = true
tnx for the explanation.  a lot of moving parts. :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0YJUECE8|silliman> has joined the channel
yeah, sorry
it looks a little convoluted but it was done that way so that the version number can be consumed in multiple places
also, I would normally have something like “-snapshot” as a suffix, but that isnt supported in vagrant
so, I am stuck with official looking tags even for “snapshot” builds
but the IS_RELEASE/git-tag is authoritative

<@U0KPFAZNF>, so i hope you don't mind... i've updated the setup.sh and Makefile within the fabric-baseimage repo and copied any s390x or ppc64 specific installations/tailoring that was in the old baseimage logic (within the fabric repo itself).  i'm testing it now.  i'm thinking of submitting a PR for this work.
i've also added some lines in setup.sh to cleanup build directories that were left over in /tmp.
Uploaded x86 and power base images (v0.2.0) to hyperledger docker hub <https://hub.docker.com/r/hyperledger/fabric-baseimage/tags/>
<@U2NDE1ZCK|jdockter> has joined the channel
